medical_history.chief_complaint: Numerous basal cell carcinomas (BCCs) and a mass in the right hard palate.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: BCCs first developed at age 16. Jaw cysts appeared at age 11. The patient presented with a mass in the right hard palate 3 years later, which was biopsied and identified as adenoid cystic carcinoma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Basal cell nevus syndrome (BCNS), with features including multiple BCCs, jaw cysts, palmar and plantar pits, epidermal cysts, intracranial calcifications, kyphoscoliosis, and pectus excavatum. Previous treatment with isotretinoin was effective in reducing new lesions.
medical_history.family_history: Family history significant for BCNS: an identical twin brother, mother, and sister had BCNS; another sibling died in infancy from medulloblastoma.
